content.user_title: Recover passwords from hashes with Hashcat
content.value_statement: Hashcat is a powerful password recovery tool used for authorized security assessments and forensic investigations. This skill provides guidance on hash identification, attack modes, and password policy testing.
actual_capabilities: Identify hash algorithm types using Hashcat example hashes
Execute dictionary, mask, and hybrid password attacks
Optimize cracking performance with GPU acceleration
Apply password mutation rules and wordlist combinations
Manage cracking sessions with checkpoint and restore
Analyze password policy strength from cracked results
limitations: No executable code included - guidance only for manual Hashcat use
Requires Hashcat and OpenCL/CUDA to be installed separately
Password cracking speed depends on hardware capabilities
Does not include wordlists or hash databases

best_practices: Always obtain written authorization before cracking any hashes
Use GPU acceleration with -w 3 flag for faster cracking on dedicated hardware
Implement session management with --session and --restore for long-running attacks
anti_patterns: Cracking hashes without verifying you have legal authorization
Running intensive cracking operations on shared or production systems
Storing cracked passwords in plaintext or unencrypted files

faq.question: What hash algorithms does Hashcat support?
faq.answer: Hashcat supports over 300 hash algorithms including MD5, SHA1, SHA256, NTLM, bcrypt, and WPA2

faq.question: What are the main attack modes?
faq.answer: Dictionary (0), Combinator (1), Brute-Force (3), Mask (3), and Hybrid (6,7) attacks are the primary modes

faq.question: How fast is password cracking?
faq.answer: Speed depends on hash algorithm, hardware, and wordlist. Modern GPUs can try billions of MD5 hashes per second

faq.question: Is password cracking legal?
faq.answer: Only legal with proper authorization. Unauthorized cracking violates laws like CFAA in the US and GDPR internationally

faq.question: What hardware do I need?
faq.answer: GPU with OpenCL or CUDA support provides best performance. CPU cracking works but is significantly slower

faq.question: How do I protect against password cracking?
faq.answer: Use strong hashing algorithms like bcrypt, enforce minimum 12-character passwords, implement MFA, and block common passwords
